content: Harini Muthukrishnan is a Research Scientist at NVIDIA’s Architecture Research Group since February 2022. Her work mainly focuses on GPU system architecture, virtualization, and scalability. Harini received a PhD from University of Michigan Computer Science and Engineering department in 2022. At Michigan, she was advised by Prof. Thomas Wenisch and her thesis focused on developing hardware and software solutions to improve multi-GPU scaling. Her research has been published at Top-tier architecture conferences such as ISCA, MICRO and HPCA, as well as recognized by a MICRO best paper nomination and an IEEE top picks honorable mention.
